page.title: 05 YOUTH PROBLEMS
page.content: In the Kingstanding area of the block, one of the main social concerns is the number of teenage{gangs}operating.They have special names and meeting places. {75% of arrests}made are of young people{under seventeen}for fighting, shoplifting, damage and burglary. The number of police officers on beat duty used to be four but now it is sixteen. One boy of twelve, who was caught stealing two bicycles, admitted to fifty-three shed burglaries of goods worth over Â£2,500. When the gangs were asked why they did such things they said it was because they had nothing else to do. Now, the local police, with social workers, probation officers and people from welfare and education are trying to raise money to start{youth clubs} and for{a gym and sports hall}to help solve the problem.
